intro: Allophylus amazonicus, commonly known as the Amazonian alder, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of South America. Allophylus amazonicus is often found in moist, shaded habitats and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native environment.
